meanings.definition: Remove (something) from a surface by rubbing or scraping.
meanings.sent1: She was erasing the pencil marks from the paper.
meanings.sent2: He erases the whiteboard after each class.
meanings.sent3: The little girl giggled while erasing her drawing with an eraser.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to be erasing the memories from his mind like an invisible hand.
meanings.sent5: The waves erasing footprints in the sand is a calming sight.

meanings.sent1: The sun slowly erases the shadows as it rises.
meanings.sent2: Rain can sometimes erase chalk drawings on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick made the rabbit appear to be erasing into thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her smile could erase any worries from his mind.
meanings.sent5: The wind erasing the clouds revealed a sky full of stars.

meanings.definition: Delete or remove (data) from a computer or electronic device.
meanings.sent1: Remember to save your work before erasing any files.
meanings.sent2: He accidentally erased all his photos from the camera.
meanings.sent3: The computer virus seemed to be erasing everything on the hard drive.
meanings.sent4: She felt a pang of regret after erasing the important email.
meanings.sent5: Erasing unnecessary files can free up space on your device.
